alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Gillespie; Kendall; Kerr; Kinney; Maverick; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 31 at 3:53AM CDT until March 31 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR THE WESTERN HILL COUNTRY, EDWARDS PLATEAU, AND RIO GRANDE PLAINS TODAY DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS... .A dry airmass remains with humidities falling into the teens today. Breezy and gusty northwest winds are also expected. This in combination with extreme fuel dryness will result in critical fire weather conditions across the western Hill County, Edwards Plateau, and the Rio Grande Plains from late this morning through early this evening. Fuels remain extremely dry, and this is leading to an active season of wildfires that are difficult to contain. Any outdoor activity that could lead to the development of sparks and resulting wildfire potential is highly discouraged!. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY ACROSS THE WESTERN HILL COUNTRY, EDWARDS PLATEAU AND RIO GRANDE PLAINS... * WINDS...Northwest 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 11 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires ignited may spread rapidly and unpredictably. Prevention of fire starts by avoiding planned burning, or by limiting activities prone to produce sparks. Take care to stop the start and spread of wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
